SeikoProspex SLA043 Limited Edition

  • Why We Love It
  • The Backstory
  • Features
  • The Brand
  • Similar Watches

To celebrate 55 years of Seiko divers comes the SLA043, a faithful recreation of the acclaimed 62MAS of 1965 with a deep blue dial and ice-blue seconds hand to recall the Japanese Antarctic Expedition of 1966. Limited to 1700 pieces worldwide.

Why We Love It

Let's begin by distinguishing between a reimagination and a recreation of an historical watch, the former being "in the style of" the original, the latter being a near exact replica. Seiko often reimagines their first diver, the 62MAS of 1965, but Seiko rarely recreates it, making the SLA043 on offer here a rare treat. There are only 1700 available world wide. The 62MAS put Seiko into the SCUBA game and has gone on to become a legend among dive watch collectors. Original examples are hard to find, clean examples nearly non-existent, and prices for an original 62MAS have skyrocketed. The biggest difference between the SLA043 and the original 62MAS is the colorway, the dial here in a rich aquatic blue with an icey seconds hand to pay tribute to the Japanese Antarctic Expedition of 1966. The packaging includes descriptions of that expedition, tying this specific reference to one of Japan's greatest, and often overlooked, expeditions. Also inside the package is a second strap in a rich blue that matches the dial. These rubber straps are nearly as legendary as the 62MAS itself, and the high quality silicone rubber is a surprisingly luxurious and comfortable material to wear. The squared-off case is cut and brushed to perfection in Ever-Brilliant stainless steel, a bright white alloy that's best compared to Rolex's 904 steel. At 39.9mm, this watch is faithful to original specs, but also at a modern size that's going to wear comfortably and look good on a wide range of wrists. Drilled lugs make changing those straps a breeze and constitute another detail faithful to the original 62MAS. The 8L35 movement beats at a standard rate of 28,800bph, providing a full 50-hours of power reserve. This auto-winding machine offers hacking (stops the seconds hand when setting), a date complication, and crown winding (useful before a dive). All this is mounted into 26 jeweled pivot points for near frictionless performance. This movement is assembled by hand in Japan for the most precise assembly Seiko offers. Specs aside, we are in love with this watch! The blue dial is rich and glossy, and when it plays through the distortions of the vintage-correct domed crystal, the show is 100% vintage Seiko diver. The ice-blue seconds hand creates visual and kinetic dynamics that bring the watch to life before your eyes. The markers and date aperture are framed in perfectly polished stainless steel, and the look is as close to the original as one could wish for. All of us at Hodinkee are thrilled to offer the SLA043 here in the shop.

The Backstory

Japan's Seiko was relatively late to the dive watch game, waiting until 1965 to release the 62MAS. However, as with all the watches Seiko released in the 20th century, the brand perfected their designs and technology before going to market, and the 62MAS remains one of the most legendary dive watches of all time because of it. Upon release, it became the go-to for professional divers around the world. Today the 62MAS resonates with our sense of the mid-century's brilliant combination of hard-wearing utility and understated casual aesthetics, an ethos that can be said to have defined industrial design the world over after WWII. But Seiko didn't imitate their Swiss and American counterparts. The design language known as "Grammar of Design" had infused itself into all of Seiko's departments by 1965, and this set of aesthetic rules (mostly describing how case surfaces would be rendered) informed the brand's acclaimed dive watches. The SAL043 faithfully recreates the 62MAS, bringing this classic mid-century diver into the 21st century.

Features

  • Reference: SLA043
  • Function: Hours, minutes, seconds, date
  • Material: Stainless steel with black hard coating
  • Dimensions: 39.9mm diameter; 14.1mm thickness
  • Crystal: Sapphire crystal
  • Caseback: Stainless steel
  • Dial: Blue
  • Lume: Yes, LumiBrite
  • Caliber: Seiko, self-winding, 8L35
  • Power Reserve: 50 hours
  • Water Resistance: 200 meters
  • Bracelet/Strap: Black silicone strap
  • Manufactured: Japan

About This Brand

Japan's premier watchmaker, Seiko is known for making outstanding watches at nearly every price point imaginable. It is one of the most vertically integrated watch manufactures in the world, even creating things like hairsprings and quartz crystals in-house. Seiko watches have a unique personality distinct from their Swiss counterparts, embracing traditional Japanese crafts and culture, including hand-polishing, enamel, lacquer, and more. Few brands offer watches that are so diverse but also united in shared spirit and values.

Privacy Preference Center

When you visit any website, it may store or retrieve information on your browser, mostly in the form of cookies. This information might be about you, your preferences or your device and is mostly used to make the site work as you expect it to. The information does not usually directly identify you, but it can give you a more personalized web experience. Because we respect your right to privacy, you can choose not to allow some types of cookies. Click on the different category headings to find out more and change our default settings. However, blocking some types of cookies may impact your experience of the site and the services we are able to offer.
More information

Manage Consent Preferences

Targeting Cookies

These cookies may be set through our site by our advertising partners. They may be used by those companies to build a profile of your interests and show you relevant adverts on other sites. They do not store directly personal information, but are based on uniquely identifying your browser and internet device. If you do not allow these cookies, you will experience less targeted advertising.

Functional Cookies

These cookies enable the website to provide enhanced functionality and personalisation. They may be set by us or by third party providers whose services we have added to our pages. If you do not allow these cookies then some or all of these services may not function properly.

Performance Cookies

These cookies allow us to count visits and traffic sources so we can measure and improve the performance of our site. They help us to know which pages are the most and least popular and see how visitors move around the site. All information these cookies collect is aggregated and therefore anonymous. If you do not allow these cookies we will not know when you have visited our site, and will not be able to monitor its performance.

Strictly Necessary Cookies

Always Active

These cookies are necessary for the website to function and cannot be switched off in our systems. They are usually only set in response to actions made by you which amount to a request for services, such as setting your privacy preferences, logging in or filling in forms. You can set your browser to block or alert you about these cookies, but some parts of the site will not then work. These cookies do not store any personally identifiable information.
